properties.areaDesc: Northern Washoe County; Surprise Valley California
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:40AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...None.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches
with amounts up to 6 inches possible over higher terrain such as
Cedar Pass. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Surprise Valley California and Northern Washoe County.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning
commutes. Gusty winds could lead to low visibility situations.
properties.instruction:
Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during
periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to
reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since
it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY
